page.title: 02Industry.
page.content: Much of the areaÂ£s early development was based on coalmining and farming. Farming is still important but the coal mines have ceased production.Dudley Pit closed in 1977.The core areas of the villages reflect this coal mining past. All the settlements have areas of ribbon development and modern estates both council and private.There are some isolated homesteads both old and new separate from the main villages.However each village still retains itÂ£s own identity. There is little new industry in the study blocks but large industrial estates exist within the area.Most residents work on these industrial estates or in Newcastle.Despite government incentives it has been difficult to attract enough new jobs to the area to replace those lost due to the decline of heavy industries.
